content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────
### Iron Plate Smelter Furnace at Position(5.0, 5.0)
• Serves as the facility for converting iron ore into iron plates.
• In recent operations, the furnace received 10 units of iron ore along with 10 units of coal and produced 30 iron plates.

### Copper Plate Smelter Furnace at Position(-27.0, -60.0)
• Serves as the facility for converting copper ore into copper plates.
• In recent operations, the furnace processed 50 units of copper ore with 10 units of coal to yield 45 copper plates.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Incorrect get_entities Usage:
  – Avoid using unsupported keyword arguments (e.g. using “radius”).
  – Ensure that the number and form of passed parameters match the function’s API signature to prevent unexpected keyword or positional argument errors.

• Lab Placement Failures:
  – Verify that the lab item is available in the inventory before attempting placement (notably at (0.5, 2.5)).
  – Confirm that prerequisites for placement are met to avoid placement errors.

• NoneType Iteration Error:
  – When filtering retrieved entities, check that the result is not None.
  – Incorporate a fallback (such as an empty list) if the get_entities call returns None to prevent iteration errors.

• Lab Crafting Resource Shortages:
  – Ensure full resource availability for lab crafting by producing all required sub-ingredients (for example, iron-gear-wheels, electronic-circuits, and copper-cables).
  – Prioritize completing the production chain (via smelting or crafting) for intermediate items so that lab recipes can be fulfilled without missing ingredients.

• Persisting Ingredient Deficits:
  – If lab crafting continues to fail due to missing components (such as an additional iron-gear-wheel requirement), re‐evaluate the resource acquisition and smelting/crafting strategy to cover the complete recipe chain.
